alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:14PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Uintah County through 145 PM MDT... At 113 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dinosaur to 33 miles southwest of Rangely. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dinosaur and Artesia. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 2 and 8. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
